intro: Palustricodon, commonly known as the marsh bellflower, is a herbaceous plant native to wetland environments. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant typically grows in shallow water or damp soil, showcasing its adaptability to moist conditions. Its leaves are broad and succulent, helping it retain moisture in its natural habitat. Palustricodon plays an important role in wetland ecosystems by stabilizing soil and providing habitat for aquatic life.
